text: (28:69) These are the words of the covenant that the Lord commanded Moses to make with the people of Israel in the land of Moab, in addition to the covenant he had made with them at Horeb.
Moses proclaimed to all Israel as follows: “You have seen all that the Lord did in the land of Egypt to Pharaoh, all his servants, and his land.

Your <st data-num="05869" class="">eyes</st> have <st data-num="07200" class="">seen</st> the <st data-num="01419" class="">great</st> <st data-num="04531" class="">judgments</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="01992" class="">those</st> <st data-num="0226" class="">signs</st> and <st data-num="01419" class="">mighty</st> <st data-num="04159" class="">wonders</st>.
But to this very day the Lord has not given you an understanding mind, perceptive eyes, or discerning ears!

I have <st data-num="01980" class="">led</st> you through the <st data-num="04057" class="">wilderness</st> for <st data-num="0705" class="">40</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st>. Your <st data-num="08008" class="">clothing</st> has <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="01086">worn out</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="03808" class="">nor</st> have your <st data-num="05275" class="">sandals</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="01086 05921 07272">deteriorated</st>.
You have eaten no bread and drunk no wine or beer—all so that you might know that I am the Lord your God!

When you <st data-num="0935" class="">came</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> <st data-num="04725" class="">place</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="05511" class="">Sihon</st> of <st data-num="02809" class="">Heshbon</st> and <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="05747" class="">Og</st> of <st data-num="01316" class="">Bashan</st> <st data-num="03318" class="">came out</st> to <st data-num="07125" class="">make</st> <st data-num="04421" class="">war</st> and we <st data-num="05221" class="">defeated</st> them.
Then we took their land and gave it as an inheritance to Reuben, Gad, and half the tribe of Manasseh.
“Therefore, keep the terms of this covenant and obey them so that you may be successful in everything you do.
You are standing today, all of you, before the Lord your God—the heads of your tribes, your elders, your officials, every Israelite man,

your <st data-num="02945" class="">infants</st>, your <st data-num="0802" class="">wives</st>, and the<n id="1" /> <st data-num="01616" class="">resident foreigners</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="0834" class="">living</st> <st data-num="07130" class="">in</st> your <st data-num="04264" class="">encampment</st>, those who <st data-num="02404" class="">chop</st> <st data-num="06086" class="">wood</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">and</st> those who <st data-num="07579" class="">carry</st> <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st>—
so that you may enter by oath into the covenant the Lord your God is making with you today.

<st data-num="03117" class="">Today</st> he will <st data-num="06965" class="">affirm</st> that you are his <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> and that <st data-num="01931" class="">he</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">is</st> your <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st>,<n id="1" /> just <st data-num="0834" class="">as</st> he <st data-num="01696" class="">promised</st> you and <st data-num="0834" class="">as</st> he <st data-num="07650" class="">swore by oath</st> to your <st data-num="01" class="">ancestors</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="085" class="">Abraham</st>, <st data-num="03327" class="">Isaac</st>, and <st data-num="03290" class="">Jacob</st>.

It is <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> you <st data-num="0905" class="">alone</st> that <st data-num="0595" class="">I</st> am <st data-num="03772" class="">making</st> <st data-num="02063" class="">this</st> <st data-num="01285" class="">covenant</st> by <st data-num="0423 02063">oath</st>,
but with whoever stands with us here today before the Lord our God as well as those not with us here today.
“(For you know how we lived in the land of Egypt and how we crossed through the nations as we traveled.

You have <st data-num="07200" class="">seen</st> their <st data-num="08251" class="">detestable things</st><n id="1" /> and <st data-num="01544" class="">idols</st> of <st data-num="06086" class="">wood</st>, <st data-num="068" class="">stone</st>, <st data-num="03701" class="">silver</st>, and <st data-num="02091 0834 05973">gold</st>.)<n id="2" />

Beware that the heart of no man, woman, clan, or tribe among you turns away from the Lord our God today to pursue and serve the gods of those nations; beware that there is among you no root producing poisonous and bitter fruit.

When such a person<n id="1" /> <st data-num="08085" class="">hears</st> the <st data-num="01697" class="">words</st> of <st data-num="02063" class="">this</st> <st data-num="0423" class="">oath</st> he <st data-num="03824" class="">secretly</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="01288" class="">blesses</st> himself<n id="3" /> and <st data-num="0559" class="">says</st>, ‘I <st data-num="01961" class="">will</st> have <st data-num="07965" class="">peace</st> <st data-num="03588" class="">though</st> I continue to <st data-num="01980" class="">walk</st> with a <st data-num="08307" class="">stubborn</st> <st data-num="03820" class="">spirit</st>.’<n id="4" /> <st data-num="04616" class="">This</st> will <st data-num="05595" class="">destroy</st><n id="5" /> the <st data-num="07302" class="">watered ground</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> the <st data-num="06771" class="">parched</st>.<n id="6" />

The Lord will be unwilling to forgive him, and his intense anger will rage against that man; all the curses written in this scroll will fall upon him, and the Lord will obliterate his name from memory.
The Lord will single him out for judgment from all the tribes of Israel according to all the curses of the covenant written in this scroll of the law.

The generation to come—your descendants who will rise up after you, as well as the foreigner who will come from distant places—will see the afflictions of that land and the illnesses that the Lord has brought on it.

The whole land will be covered with brimstone, salt, and burning debris; it will not be planted nor will it sprout or produce grass. It will resemble the destruction of Sodom and Gomorrah, Admah and Zeboyim, which the Lord destroyed in his intense anger.
Then all the nations will ask, ‘Why has the Lord done all this to this land? What is this fierce, heated display of anger all about?’
Then people will say, ‘Because they abandoned the covenant of the Lord, the God of their ancestors, which he made with them when he brought them out of the land of Egypt.

They <st data-num="01980" class="">went</st> and <st data-num="05647" class="">served</st> <st data-num="0312" class="">other</st> <st data-num="0430" class="">gods</st> and <st data-num="07812" class="">worshiped</st> them, <st data-num="0430" class="">gods</st> they did <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="03045" class="">know</st> and that he did <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="02505" class="">permit</st> them <st data-num="02505" class="">to worship</st>.<n id="1" />
That is why the Lord’s anger erupted against this land, bringing on it all the curses written in this scroll.
So the Lord has uprooted them from their land in anger, wrath, and great rage and has deported them to another land, as is clear today.’
The secret things belong to the Lord our God, but those that are revealed belong to us and our descendants forever, so that we might obey all the words of this law.
